class_notes:
(Same as REL 270 6, AAS 285 3, LACS 270 3)
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Region, Theme. 
This course introduces students to Afro-Cuba and major figures that contributed to the development of Cuban culture. The religious traditions we will cover include: Regla de Ocha (Lucumi/Santeria), Reglas de Palo, Abakua, and Espiritismo. The course trajectory will take us from a history of the Caribbean focusing on Cuba to an in-depth analysis of the most well-known Orishas (deities) in Afro-Cuban religions. We will conclude by turning our attention to the ways Afro-Cuban religiosity is articulated through various forms of popular culture like music, film, literature, and art.
